info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:01PM CDT until May 17 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CAMERON COUNTY... At 501 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over El Jardin Elementary School, or over Southmost, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Port Of Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, B I S D Administration Building, Longoria Elementary School, Sams Memorial Stadium and Hanna High School. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
